context: evidence-based parent training for diverse families (ptdf) abstract  historically, bias in the u.s. has made it difficult for lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and queer (lgbtq+) people to marry and form families. the situation is changing, due to a recent dramatic shift in legal and societal acceptance of lgbtq+ marriage and family building. people who identify as lgbtq+ and whose relationships do not fit within heterosexual and/or cisgender norms—are increasingly havin
title: Evidence-based Parent Training for Diverse Families (PTDF)
explanation: The text discusses the historical bias against LGBTQ+ people in the US, legal and societal acceptance, and relationships that do not fit within heterosexual and/or cisgender norms. This clearly places the usage within a social, political, or identity context rather than a strictly scientific one.

context: redict future stbs in rural sexual minority adults. this k08 uses exploratory sequential mixed methods to complete two studies and four research aims. in study 1, aim 1 will use qualitative interviews to explore rural sexual minority adults’ perceived stb risk processes within and outside rural and lgbtqia+ communities. qualitative data will inform assessments in study 2. study 2 includes a fully remote ecological momentary assessment (ema) protocol. the ema protocol includes 6 surveys per day for 21 days, where participants will report on their stbs, known stb risk factors (stigma, low belonging)
title: Predicting acute and dynamic suicide risk in rural sexual minorities
explanation: The term 'lgbtqia+' (and therefore 'lgbt' implicitly) is used within the context of a research study focused on suicide risk in a specific population group. The study uses scientific methodologies (qualitative interviews, ecological momentary assessment) to explore and predict behaviors and risk factors within this population.

context: biases. mixed methods analysis will explore whether exposure to inclusive biology lesson plans can change the prevalence of gender essentialist, transphobic, or homophobic attitudes, change stem and career interest, and whether any of these potential effects vary by student identity, especially for lgbtq students.    the project plan includes supportive activities for the pi through an aligned professional development plan engaged through trainings, conferences, and the support of expert mentors. these advisors will assist the pi in attaining the skills needed for development as a stem education r
title: Impacts of Inclusive Biology Curriculum on Student Attitudes and STEM Interest
explanation: The term "lgbtq students" is used in the context of student identity and how it relates to attitudes and STEM interest, indicating a social and identity context.

context: sexual and gender minorities (sgm) experience among the largest mental health disparities of any population, at substantial cost to society. one driver has been the lack of evidence-based practice (ebp) addressing the distinct mechanisms underlying sgm's risk. for 10+ years, our team has developed lgbtq- affirmative cognitive-behavioral therapy (cbt) as the first and only ebp specifically for sgm mental health, now in high demand. this proposal seeks to study optimal means of implementing this effective treatment at lgbtq community centers nationwide to advance implementation science and health e
title: Implementing sustainable evidence-based mental healthcare in low-resource community settings nationwide to advance mental health equity for sexual and gender minority individuals
explanation: The term 'lgbt' is used in the context of mental health disparities, evidence-based practices, and intervention strategies, all of which fall within a scientific and research-oriented domain.

context: fostering stem identify development through localized engineering for lgbtq+ youth displaced by housing insecurity the project will develop and research a model for engaging lgbtq+ youth experiencing housing insecurity in an engineering education program. this research program explicitly broadens engineering and stem participation through a three-year design-based researc
title: Fostering STEM identify development through localized engineering for LGBTQ+ youth displaced by housing insecurity
explanation: The term 'lgbtq+' is used to identify a specific group of people facing social and systemic challenges (housing insecurity) and to whom the engineering program is targeted, indicating a focus on social equity and identity.

title: Intervention to improve parent communication about sexuality with sexual minority male adolescents
explanation: The term 'lgbtq' refers to a specific population group (sexual minority male adolescents) being studied within a health-related research project. The context focuses on parental acceptance and its impact on the health of this group, indicating a scientific investigation of health outcomes related to sexual orientation and identity.
